title: Anacostia Park: Management
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management             Management              Rehabilitation Efforts  Anacostia Wetland Management              Anacostia Park is a unit of the National Park Service, and is managed by National Capital Parks-East. The park is a model urban park that provides for better water quality, wildlife habitat, and flood mitigation, while providing public access to boat ramps, fishing, picnic areas, and recreation fields.  Laws and Policies that govern the site include federal and National Park Service laws and regulations, and other policies in the Superintendent's Compendium. Questions? Contact us.      Documents Open for Public Review  Loading ...  There are currently no projects with documents open for public review for Anacostia Park.    Other Plans and Projects An archive of completed projects as well as projects without documents open for comment may be found on the PEPC website.        Anacostia Park Environmental Cleanup  Kenilworth Park Landfill Site Poplar Point Site Washington Gas - East Station Site    Records  Rock N Roll USA Marathon, March 15, 2014 - Record of Determination Anacostia Riverwalk Environmental Assessment / Record of Decision (.pdf) Wetlands Restoration Plan/Environmental Assessment with Resident Canada Goose Management Strategies - The finished Environmental Assessment is available for viewing at Kenilworth Aquatic Gardens visitor center.
